nodes.bodyText:
Is LTPA token or LTPA cookie correct? The message says "token" and the description says "Token cookie". Terms and capitalization should be consistent.
also- remove future tense:
change
The LTPA Cookie will not add to the HTTP response.
to
The LTPA Cookie does not add to the HTTP response.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -58,3 +58,7 @@ includeClientGSSCredentialInSubject.desc=Specifies whether the client delegation
 authFilterRef=Authentication Filter Reference
 authFilterRef$Ref=Authentication filter reference
 authFilterRef.desc=Specifies the authentication filter reference. 
+
+disableLtpaCookie=Disable LTPA token
+disableLtpaCookie.desc=Do not create an LTPA Token cookie during processing of the SPNEGO token. The LTPA Cookie will not add to the HTTP response.

nodes.bodyText:
The LTPA Cookie does not add to the HTTP response.
does this mean that the LTPA is not included in the response? In the current sentence, it's not clear what is not being added. Is it correct to say
No LTPA cookie is added to the HTTP response.

@@ -58,3 +58,7 @@ includeClientGSSCredentialInSubject.desc=Specifies whether the client delegation
 authFilterRef=Authentication Filter Reference
 authFilterRef$Ref=Authentication filter reference
 authFilterRef.desc=Specifies the authentication filter reference. 
+
+disableLtpaCookie=Disable LTPA Cookie
+disableLtpaCookie.desc=Do not create an LTPA cookie during processing of the SPNEGO token. The LTPA Cookie does not add to the HTTP response.

nodes.bodyText: This comment seems to be extra and it appears that it was intended for the AuthenticationConstants.java class, which has this new comment already.
There may be a defect in this path if someone adds AuthenticationConstants.INTERNAL_DISABLE_SSO_LTPA_COOKIE with a value of false to the hashtable. The cookie should still be created in that case.
It's an internal property and default is false. I check for true any way
